The SQL statement or statements to be executed. When multiple statements are passed to the function, they are automatically executed as one transaction, unless there are explicit BEGIN/COMMIT commands included in the query string. However, using multiple transactions in one function call is not recommended.
The SQL statement to prepare and execute.
The SQL statement.
The SQL type used to represent the column value in the database. If the column in the result set is the result of a function, this value is not returned by PDOStatement::getColumnMeta().

The SQLSRV extension does not have a dedicated function for changing which database is connected to. The target database is specified in the $connectionOptions array that is passed to sqlsrv_connect. To change the database on an open connection, execute the following query "USE dbName" (e.g. sqlsrv_query($conn, "USE dbName")).

The Scope Resolution Operator (also called Paamayim Nekudotayim) or in simpler terms, the double colon, is a token that allows access to static, constant, and overridden properties or methods of a class.

The SplFileObject class offers an object oriented interface for a file.
The SplFixedArray class

The SplFixedArray class provides the main functionalities of array. The main differences between a SplFixedArray and a normal PHP array is that the SplFixedArray is of fixed length and allows only integers within the range as indexes. The advantage is that it allows a faster array implementation.
The SplFloat class
The SplFloat class is used to enforce strong typing of the float type.
The SplHeap class
The SplHeap class provides the main functionalities of a Heap.
The SplInt class
The SplInt class is used to enforce strong typing of the integer type.
The SplMaxHeap class
The SplMaxHeap class provides the main functionalities of a heap, keeping the maximum on the top.
The SplMinHeap class
The SplMinHeap class provides the main functionalities of a heap, keeping the minimum on the top.
The SplObjectStorage class
The SplObjectStorage class provides a map from objects to data or, by ignoring data, an object set. This dual purpose can be useful in many cases involving the need to uniquely identify objects.
The SplObserver interface
The SplPriorityQueue class
The SplPriorityQueue class provides the main functionalities of a prioritized queue, implemented using a max heap.
The SplQueue class
The SplQueue class provides the main functionalities of a queue implemented using a doubly linked list.
The SplStack class
The SplStack class provides the main functionalities of a stack implemented using a doubly linked list.
The SplString class
The SplString class is used to enforce strong typing of the string type.

The Transmission Control Protocol is a reliable, connection based, stream oriented, full duplex protocol. TCP guarantees that all data packets will be received in the order in which they were sent. If any packet is somehow lost during communication, TCP will automatically retransmit the packet until the destination host acknowledges that packet. For reliability and performance reasons, the TCP implementation itself decides the appropriate octet boundaries of the underlying datagram communication layer. Therefore, TCP applications must allow for the possibility of partial record transmission.

The User Datagram Protocol is a connectionless, unreliable, protocol with fixed record lengths. Due to these aspects, UDP requires a minimum amount of protocol overhead.

The WeakRef class
The WeakRef class provides a gateway to objects without preventing the garbage collector from freeing those objects. It also provides a way to turn a weak reference into a strong one.

The Windows implementation of mail() differs in many ways from the Unix implementation. First, it doesn't use a local binary for composing messages but only operates on direct sockets which means a MTA is needed listening on a network socket (which can either on the localhost or a remote machine).

The Zend Engine 1, driving PHP 4, implements the static and global modifier for variables in terms of references. For example, a true global variable imported inside a function scope with the global statement actually creates a reference to the global variable. This can lead to unexpected behaviour which the following example addresses:
The ZipArchive class

The ability to refer to an external fully qualified name with an alias, or importing, is an important feature of namespaces. This is similar to the ability of unix-based filesystems to create symbolic links to a file or to a directory.

The above code can be slow, because the array size is fetched on every iteration. Since the size never changes, the loop be easily optimized by using an intermediate variable to store the size instead of repeatedly calling count():
The above code will produce the following information in the profiling file:

The above example code can be easily exploited by passing in a string such as <h1>{${eval($_GET[php_code])}}</h1>. This gives the attacker the ability to execute arbitrary PHP code and as such gives them nearly complete access to your server.
The above example creates constant MyProject\Sub\Level\CONNECT_OK, class MyProject\Sub\Level\Connection and function MyProject\Sub\Level\connect.
The above example produces a pair of separate keys, suitable for creation of an encrypt-then-HMAC construct, using AES-256 and SHA-256 for encryption and authentication respectively.

The above loop would run one time exactly, since after the first iteration, when truth expression is checked, it evaluates to FALSE ($i is not bigger than 0) and the loop execution ends.

The above script will output 3. By declaring $a and $b global within the function, all references to either variable will refer to the global version. There is no limit to the number of global variables that can be manipulated by a function.
The above will appear to have two keys named 'AA', although one of them is actually named '\0A\0A'.
The absolute base URI of this node or NULL if the implementation wasn't able to obtain an absolute URI.

The accuracy.

The address of the page (if any) which referred the user agent to the current page. This is set by the user agent. Not all user agents will set this, and some provide the ability to modify <var><var>HTTP_REFERER</var></var> as a feature. In short, it cannot really be trusted.
The address specified when the socket stream was created will be used unless an alternate address is specified in address.

The alias must be defined in <var>php.ini</var>, and not <var>.htaccess</var> or <var>httpd.conf</var>
The alias name for the class.
The alias that can be used in phar:// URLs to refer to this archive, rather than its full path.

The alias that may be used to refer to the phar archive. Note that many phar archives specify an explicit alias inside the phar archive, and a PharException will be thrown if a new alias is specified in this case.
The alias to add.
The alias to remove.
The alternative syntax for control structures is supported with switches. For more information, see Alternative syntax for control structures.
The amount by which to decrement the item's value.
The amount by which to increment the item's value.
The amount of bucket lists to configure. The number you pass in will be automatically rounded up to the next power of two. It is also automatically limited from 4 to 4194304.
The amount of bucket lists to configure. The number you pass in will be automatically rounded up to the next power of two. It is also automatically limited from 64 to 4194304.
The amount of contrast to apply. 1 is very little, 5 is a significant amount, 20 is extreme.
The amount of fuzz. For example, set fuzz to 10 and the color red at intensities of 100 and 102 respectively are now interpreted as the same color for the purposes of the floodfill.
The amount of fuzz. For example, set fuzz to 10 and the color red at intensities of 100 and 102 respectively are now interpreted as the same color.
The amount of gamma-correction.
The amount of memory cannot be resized later. Request sufficient storage up front.
The amount of time expressed in 'ticks' that the image should be displayed for. For animated GIFs there are 100 ticks per second, so a value of 20 would be 20/100 of a second aka 1/5th of a second.
The amount of time the process is allowed to use the CPU.
The amount of time the server will wait to delete the item.
The amount of time the server will wait to delete the items.
The amount to displace the colormap.
The amplitude of the wave.
The angle at which to write the text
The angle in degrees, with 0 degrees being left-to-right reading text. Higher values represent a counter-clockwise rotation. For example, a value of 90 would result in bottom-to-top reading text.
The angle of the blur in degrees.
The angle to apply the blur over.

The appended child.

The array. This array is passed by reference because it is modified by the function. This means you must pass it a real variable and not a function returning an array because only actual variables may be passed by reference.

The assertion. In PHP 5, this must be either a string to be evaluated or a boolean to be tested. In PHP 7, this may also be any expression that returns a value, which will be executed and the result used to indicate whether the assertion succeeded or failed.

The atime of a file is supposed to change whenever the data blocks of a file are being read. This can be costly performance-wise when an application regularly accesses a very large number of files or directories.
The attribute list name.
The attribute name.
The attribute node.
The attribute node. Note that for XML namespace declarations (xmlns and xmlns:* attributes) an instance of DOMNameSpaceNode is returned instead of a DOMAttr object.
The attribute node. Note that for XML namespace declarations (xmlns and xmlns:* attributes) an instance of DOMNameSpaceNode is returned instead of a DOMAttr.
The attribute that you want to get.
The attribute that you want to set. It can have one of the following values:

The authenticated user.

The average user may be used to shell patterns or at least in their simplest form to '?' and '*' wildcards so using fnmatch() instead of preg_match() for frontend search expression input may be way more convenient for non-programming users.

The backslash character has several uses. Firstly, if it is followed by a non-alphanumeric character, it takes away any special meaning that character may have. This use of backslash as an escape character applies both inside and outside character classes.
The backtick operator is disabled when safe mode is enabled or shell_exec() is disabled.
The base number is in

The base URI of the node
The base directory of the templates, by default, it is APPLICATOIN . "/views" for Yaf.
The base for the conversion

The base may vary from 2 to 36. If base is 0 (default value), the actual base is determined from the leading characters: if the first two characters are 0x or 0X, hexadecimal is assumed, otherwise if the first character is "0", octal is assumed, otherwise decimal is assumed.
The base name of the current DirectoryIterator item.
The base number.
The base of the returned number. The default base is 10. Allowed values for the base are from 2 to 62 and -2 to -36.
The base to convert number to
The base to use
The base, as a string.
The base, as an integral string (i.e. the scale has to be zero).
The base-10 logarithm of arg
The base.

The basic assignment operator is "=". Your first inclination might be to think of this as "equal to". Don't. It really means that the left operand gets set to the value of the expression on the right (that is, "gets set to").
The behavior of assert() may be configured by assert_options() or by .ini-settings described in that functions manual page.
The behavior of unset() inside of a function can vary depending on what type of variable you are attempting to destroy.
The behavior of the iterator (either one or the other):
The behavior of this function is almost identical to mb_ereg_replace(), except for the fact that instead of replacement parameter, one should specify a callback.
The behavior of this function is almost identical to preg_replace(), except for the fact that instead of replacement parameter, one should specify a callback.
The behavior of this function is similar to preg_replace_callback(), except that callbacks are executed on a per-pattern basis.

The behaviour of mysqli_num_rows() depends on whether buffered or unbuffered result sets are being used. For unbuffered result sets, mysqli_num_rows() will not return the correct number of rows until all the rows in the result have been retrieved.
The behaviour of an automatic conversion to array is currently undefined.
The behaviour of converting to integer is undefined for other types. Do not rely on any observed behaviour, as it can change without notice.
The bidirectional category value; one of the following constants:
The binary dump being loaded, likely from apc_bin_dump().
The binary string being imported
The binary string to convert

The binding (i.e. protocol) to use to communicate with the service (e.g binding.jsonrpc for a json-rpc service). Note, some service types can be deduced from the target parameter (e.g. if the target parameter ends in .wsdl then SCA will assume binding.soap). Any binding which can be specified in an annotation can be specified here. For example 'binding.soap' is equivalent to the '@binding.soap' annotation.
The bit to test
The bitwise | (or) operator can be used to combine more than one method. If this is done, cURL will poll the server to see what methods it supports and pick the best one.
The black point.
The block of code to execute
The blue primary x-point.
The blue primary y-point.
The blur factor where > 1 is blurry, < 1 is sharp.
The blur factor where larger than 1 is blurry, lesser than 1 is sharp.
The blur factor where larger than 1 is blurry, smaller than 1 is sharp.
The blurred Gmagick object
The body of the response.
The body section to read
The body size in bytes.
The boost value for the field
The border color
The border color. A color identifier created with imagecolorallocate().
The border pixel wand.
The boundary string.

The bounding box is calculated using information available from character metrics, and unfortunately tends to differ slightly from the results achieved by actually rasterizing the text. If the angle is 0 degrees, you can expect the text to need 1 pixel more to every direction.
The buffer event options.
The buffer mode.
The buffer to be written.
The buffer.
The byte stream to check. If it is omitted, this function checks all the input from the beginning of the request.
The c-space function where exception was generated
The c-space source file where exception was generated

The cache expire is reset to the default value of 180 stored in session.cache_expire at request startup time. Thus, you need to call session_cache_expire() for every request (and before session_start() is called).

The cache limiter defines which cache control HTTP headers are sent to the client. These headers determine the rules by which the page content may be cached by the client and intermediate proxies. Setting the cache limiter to nocache disallows any client/proxy caching. A value of public permits caching by proxies and the client, whereas private disallows caching by proxies and permits the client to cache the contents.

The cache limiter is reset to the default value stored in session.cache_limiter at request startup time. Thus, you need to call session_cache_limiter() for every request (and before session_start() is called).
The cache type, which will be user or file.
The calculation of the height if new_height was negative or omitted was fixed; prior to these versions, the aspect ratio was not maintained correctly.

The calendar created will represent the time instance at which it was created, based on the system time. The fields can all be cleared by calling IntCalendar::clear() with no arguments. See also IntlGregorianCalendar::__construct().
The calendar mode (see table above).
The calendar must be lenient for this option to have any effect, otherwise attempting to set a non-existing time will cause an error.
The calendar object, on the procedural style interface.
The calendar to compare with the primary object.
The calendar whose time will be checked against the primary objects time.
The callable should return what the key will be mapped to in the resulting map.
The callable should return what the new value will be in the new deque.
The callable should return what the new value will be in the new sequence.
The callable should return what the new value will be in the new vector.
The callable to convert.
The callback callable . It should match the following prototype:
The callback callable that gets invoked on requested path . It should match the following prototype:
The callback comparison function.

The callback function should accept three arguments. The first argument will contain the file the assertion failed in. The second argument will contain the line the assertion failed on and the third argument will contain the expression that failed (if any — literal values such as 1 or "two" will not be passed via this argument). Users of PHP 5.4.8 and later may also provide a fourth optional argument, which will contain the description given to assert(), if it was set.
The callback function should return the number of characters stored in the buffer or a negative value if an error occurred.
The callback function to call on every element. This function only receives the given args, so it is nullary by default. If count($args) === 3, for instance, the callback function is ternary.
The callback function to use
The callback is called with the event name and the link resource as arguments whenever one of the specified events is posted by the database.
The callback is expected to return TRUE if the current item is to be accepted, or FALSE otherwise.

The callback is guaranteed to be invoked only after its timeout has passed (not at, so on systems with very low-resolution clocks this might introduce a small delay). If multiple timers become ready during the same loop iteration then the ones with earlier time-out values are invoked before ones of the same priority with later time-out values (but this is no longer true when a callback calls EvLoop::run() recursively).
The callback is only called when the CURLOPT_NOPROGRESS option is set to FALSE.
The callback must return FALSE if the event handler should be canceled. Any other return value is ignored. This function accepts up to 15 event arguments.
The callback should accept up to three arguments: the current item, the current key and the iterator, respectively.
The callback should return what the value should be replaced by.
The callback, which should return TRUE to accept the current item or FALSE otherwise. See Examples.
The callback, which should return TRUE to accept the current item or FALSE otherwise. See Examples.
The callbacks task is to read input from the file specified in the LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE and to reformat it into the format understood by LOAD DATA INFILE.
The caller needs to supply data chunks with EventHttpRequest::sendReplyChunk() and complete the reply by calling EventHttpRequest::sendReplyEnd() .
The casts allowed are:
The catalog name, always "def" (since PHP 5.3.6)
The category
The center of rotation is the center of the image, and the rotated image may have different dimensions than the original image.
The certificate store contents, not its file name.
The certificate.
The challenge associated to associate with the SPKAC
The channel to check, specified as one of the Gmagick channel constants.
The character = followed by a (single byte) character f to be used as the numeric fill character. The default fill character is space.
The character encoding before conversion for success, or FALSE for failure.
The character encoding name, as per the type. If mb_http_input() does not process specified HTTP input, it returns FALSE.
The character encoding specified by mb_regex_encoding() will be used as the character encoding for this function by default.

The character has a decimal digit value. Such characters have the general category "Nd" (decimal digit numbers) and a Numeric_Type of Decimal. In this case the value is the character's decimal digit value.
The character is one of the lowercase Latin letters 'a' through 'z'. In this case the value is ch-'a'+10.
The character is one of the uppercase Latin letters 'A' through 'Z'. In this case the value is c-'A'+10.
The character offset at which to insert.
The character representation (as a string) of the specified digit in the specified radix.

The character set must be set either at the server level, or with the API function mysqli_set_charset() for it to affect mysqli_real_escape_string(). See the concepts section on character sets for more information.

The character set must be set either on the server level, or within the database connection itself (depending on the driver) for it to affect PDO::quote(). See the driver-specific documentation for more information.
The character set number (id) for the field.
The character set number for the field.
The character set.
The character to draw.

The character types \d, \D, \s, \S, \w, and \W may also appear in a character class, and add the characters that they match to the class. For example, [\dABCDEF] matches any hexadecimal digit. A circumflex can conveniently be used with the upper case character types to specify a more restricted set of characters than the matching lower case type. For example, the class [^\W_] matches any letter or digit, but not underscore.
The character used to pad to the format width.
The charset to be set as default.
The check is done using the real UID/GID instead of the effective one.
The chopped Gmagick object
The chromaticity blue primary x-point.
The chromaticity blue primary y-point.
The chromaticity green primary x-point.
The chromaticity green primary y-point.
The chunk length.
The chunk size. Must be a value greater than 0. The default value is 100.
The cipher method, see openssl_get_cipher_methods() for a list of potential values.
The cipher method.
The cipher method. For a list of available cipher methods, use openssl_get_cipher_methods().
The class constant name.
The class for new Workers. If no class is given, then it defaults to the Worker class.
The class implementing the interface must use the exact same method signatures as are defined in the interface. Not doing so will result in a fatal error.
The class in which to redefine the method
The class in which to remove the method
The class in which to rename the method
The class method name.
The class name
The class name being checked against.
The class name being searched.

The class name can be any valid label, provided it is not a PHP reserved word. A valid class name starts with a letter or underscore, followed by any number of letters, numbers, or underscores. As a regular expression, it would be expressed thus: ^[a-zA-Z_\x7f-\xff][a-zA-Z0-9_\x7f-\xff]*$.
The class name or an object instance
The class name or an object of the class to test for

The class name resolution using ::class is a compile time transformation. That means at the time the class name string is created no autoloading has happened yet. As a consequence, class names are expanded even if the class does not exist. No error is issued in that case.
The class name to use when SplFileInfo::getFileInfo() and SplFileInfo::getPathInfo() are called.
The class name to use when SplFileInfo::openFile() is called.
The class name, that contains the property.
The class name.

The class name. The class name includes the namespace it was declared in (e.g. Foo\Bar). Note that as of PHP 5.4 __CLASS__ works also in traits. When used in a trait method, __CLASS__ is the name of the class the trait is used in.
The class name. The name is matched in a case-insensitive manner.
The class now implements DateTimeInterface.

The class scope to which associate the closure is to be associated, or 'static' to keep the current one. If an object is given, the type of the object will be used instead. This determines the visibility of protected and private methods of the bound object. It is not allowed to pass (an object of) an internal class as this parameter.
The class short name.
The class to extend
The class to which this method will be added
The classname of the array iterator to use when iterating over this object.
The classname which implements the protocol.
The cleared Gmagick object
The client encoding, or FALSE on error.
The clone method prevents an object from being cloned. Reflection objects cannot be cloned.
The cloned node.

The close callback works like a destructor in classes and is executed after the session write callback has been called. It is also invoked when session_write_close() is called. Return value should be TRUE for success, FALSE for failure.
The closest matching language tag or default value.

The closing identifier must begin in the first column of the line. Also, the identifier must follow the same naming rules as any other label in PHP: it must contain only alphanumeric characters and underscores, and must start with a non-digit character or underscore.

The closing tag of a PHP block at the end of a file is optional, and in some cases omitting it is helpful when using include or require, so unwanted whitespace will not occur at the end of files, and you will still be able to add headers to the response later. It is also handy if you use output buffering, and would not like to see added unwanted whitespace at the end of the parts generated by the included files.
The closure to use for ::run

The code must not be wrapped in opening and closing PHP tags, i.e. 'echo "Hi!";' must be passed instead of '<?php echo "Hi!"; ?>'. It is still possible to leave and re-enter PHP mode though using the appropriate PHP tags, e.g. 'echo "In PHP mode!"; ?>In HTML mode!<?php echo "Back in PHP mode!";'.
The code set
The code string to be executed.
The code to be evaluated when methodname is called
The code will be executed in the scope of the code calling eval(). Thus any variables defined or changed in the eval() call will remain visible after it terminates.
The codepage of the subject string. Either the codepage name or identifier.
The codepage to convert the subject string to. Either the codepage name or identifier.
The color count is the number of pixels in the image that have the same color as this ImagickPixel.
The color definition to use in order to initialise the GmagickPixel object.
The color definition to use in order to initialise the ImagickPixel object.
The color identifier.
The color in which the text will be painted.
The color index.
The color index. Using the negative of a color index has the effect of turning off antialiasing. See imagecolorallocate().
The color of the ellipse. A color identifier created with imagecolorallocate().
The color to get the value of, specified as one of the Imagick color constants. This can be one of the RGB colors, CMYK colors, alpha and opacity e.g (Imagick::COLOR_BLUE, Imagick::COLOR_MAGENTA).
The color to which the text will try to fade in with antialiasing. No pixels with the color background are actually painted, so the background image does not need to be of solid color.
The colors parameters are integers between 0 and 255 or hexadecimals between 0x00 and 0xFF.
The colorspace the image should be transformed to, one of the COLORSPACE constants e.g. Imagick::COLORSPACE_CMYK.
The column name.
The column number at which the tags is located in the file

The column of values to return. This value may be an integer key of the column you wish to retrieve, or it may be a string key name for an associative array or property name. It may also be NULL to return complete arrays or objects (this is useful together with index_key to reindex the array).
The column offset of the composited image
The column to use as the index/keys for the returned array. This value may be the integer key of the column, or it may be the string key name.
The column where the error occurred.
The column. This parameter accepts the following search patterns: "%" to match zero or more characters, and "_" to match a single character.

The comma after the last array element is optional and can be omitted. This is usually done for single-line arrays, i.e. array(1, 2) is preferred over array(1, 2, ). For multi-line arrays on the other hand the trailing comma is commonly used, as it allows easier addition of new elements at the end.
The command
The command string that was passed to proc_open().
The command that will be escaped.
The command that will be executed.
The command to execute
The command to execute.
The comment string to add to vector output stream
The comment to add
The compared node.
The compared value.

The comparison function must return an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if the first argument is considered to be respectively less than, equal to, or greater than the second. Note that before PHP 7.0.0 this integer had to be in the range from -2147483648 to 2147483647.

The comparison of keys (indices) is done also by the callback function key_compare_func. This behaviour is unlike what array_udiff_assoc() does, since the latter compares the indices by using an internal function.
The complex syntax can be recognised by the curly braces surrounding the expression.
The compressed size.
The compressed string or FALSE if an error occurred.
The compressed string, or an error number if an error occurred.
The compression algorithm. Either ZLIB_ENCODING_RAW, ZLIB_ENCODING_DEFLATE or ZLIB_ENCODING_GZIP.
The compression level in range -1..9; defaults to -1.
The compression memory level in range 1..9; defaults to 8.
The compression method.
The compression method. Either ZipArchive::CM_DEFAULT, ZipArchive::CM_STORE or ZipArchive::CM_DEFLATE.
The compression type. See the Imagick::COMPRESSION_* constants.

The condition is a positive lookahead assertion that matches an optional sequence of non-letters followed by a letter. In other words, it tests for the presence of at least one letter in the subject. If a letter is found, the subject is matched against the first alternative; otherwise it is matched against the second. This pattern matches strings in one of the two forms dd-aaa-dd or dd-dd-dd, where aaa are letters and dd are digits.

The config config can be passed either as an array or as a string. If a string is passed, it is interpreted as the name of the configuration file, otherwise, it is interpreted as the options themselves.
The configuration file
The configuration line, <var>php.ini</var> location, build date, Web Server, System and more.
The configuration option name.
The connected-to database.
The connection about which information is returned.
The connection id returned by this functions is needed by other ODBC functions. You can have multiple connections open at once as long as they either use different db or different credentials.
The connection object over which to send the request.
The connection on which the transaction is to be committed.
The connection resource returned by a call to sqlsrv_connect().
The connection resource that connects the client and the server.
The connection timeout, in seconds.
The connection to be closed.
The constant ENT_IGNORE was added.

The constant name.

The constants ENT_SUBSTITUTE, ENT_DISALLOWED, ENT_HTML401, ENT_XML1, ENT_XHTML and ENT_HTML5 were added.
The constructor to use for anonymous object

The consumer secret provided by the service provider.

The content of the text.
The contents of an OpenSSL private key, as extracted from a certificate or OpenSSL key file:
The contents of the params parameter passed to stream_filter_append() or stream_filter_prepend().

The contents of the "Accept-Encoding: " header. This enables decoding of the response. Supported encodings are "identity", "deflate", and "gzip". If an empty string, "", is set, a header containing all supported encoding types is sent.
The contents of the "Cookie: " header to be used in the HTTP request. Note that multiple cookies are separated with a semicolon followed by a space (e.g., "fruit=apple; colour=red")
The contents of the "Referer: " header to be used in a HTTP request.
The contents of the "User-Agent: " header to be used in a HTTP request.
The contents of the CDATA.
The contents of the comment.
The contents of the ini file being parsed.
The contents of the node.
The contents of the output buffer.
The contents of the section will be decoded according to their transfer encoding - base64, quoted-printable and uuencoded text are supported.
The contents of the text.

The contents of this internal buffer may be copied into a string variable using ob_get_contents(). To output what is stored in the internal buffer, use ob_end_flush(). Alternatively, ob_end_clean() will silently discard the buffer contents.
The contents to use to create the entry. It is used in a binary safe mode.
The context passed to the filename stream. See the file_put_contents() documentation for details.
The context the escaped string will be used in: LDAP_ESCAPE_FILTER for filters to be used with ldap_search(), or LDAP_ESCAPE_DN for DNs.
The conversion option.
The converted string.
The converted entities are: &, " (when ENT_NOQUOTES is not set), ' (when ENT_QUOTES is set), < and >.
The converted value is returned, and can be a boolean, integer, float, string, array or object.
The convolution kernel

The coordinates given by x and y will define the basepoint of the first character (roughly the lower-left corner of the character). This is different from the imagestring(), where x and y define the upper-left corner of the first character. For example, "top left" is 0, 0.
The copied node or FALSE, if it cannot be copied.

The created IntlDateFormatter or FALSE in case of failure.

The currency symbol.

The current runtime locale
The current seek offset (in number of bytes) from the beginning of the large object. If there is an error, the return value is negative.
The current state of SSL connection: EventBufferEvent::SSL_OPEN , EventBufferEvent::SSL_ACCEPTING or EventBufferEvent::SSL_CONNECTING .
The current user is the user under which PHP runs. It is probably not the same user you use for normal shell or FTP access. The mode can be changed only by user who owns the file on most systems.

The current value.

The currently recognized parameter keywords are: host, hostaddr, port, dbname (defaults to value of user), user, password, connect_timeout, options, tty (ignored), sslmode, requiressl (deprecated in favor of sslmode), and service. Which of these arguments exist depends on your PostgreSQL version.

The dataset is now sorted, and will look like this:
The date formatter resource.

The date of Easter Day was defined by the Council of Nicaea in AD325 as the Sunday after the first full moon which falls on or after the Spring Equinox. The Equinox is assumed to always fall on 21st March, so the calculation reduces to determining the date of the full moon and the date of the following Sunday. The algorithm used here was introduced around the year 532 by Dionysius Exiguus. Under the Julian Calendar (for years before 1753) a simple 19-year cycle is used to track the phases of the Moon. Under the Gregorian Calendar (for years after 1753 - devised by Clavius and Lilius, and introduced by Pope Gregory XIII in October 1582, and into Britain and its then colonies in September 1752) two correction factors are added to make the cycle more accurate.
The date to compare to.
The day as a number from 1 to 30
The day as a number from 1 to 31
The day as a number from 1 to 31. If the month has less days then given, overflow occurs; see the example below.
The day as a number from 1 to 30. If the month has only 29 days, the first day of the following month is assumed.
The day as a number, the valid range depends on the calendar
The day is within the allowed number of days for the given month. Leap years are taken into consideration.
The day of the year (starting from 0)
The decimal digit value of codepoint, or -1 if it is not a decimal digit character.
The decimal point character is defined in the script's locale (category LC_NUMERIC). See the setlocale() function.
The decimal representation of hex_string
The decimal representation of octal_string
The decimal separator.
The decimal value of binary_string
The decimal value to convert.
The decoded string in internal character encoding.
The decoded elements are returned in an array of objects, where each object has two properties, charset and text.
The decoded string, or FALSE if an error occurred.
The decompressed string, or an error number if an error occurred.
The decrypted message is written to the file specified by outfilename.
The decrypted string on success or FALSE on failure.

The decryption handle should always be initialized with mcrypt_generic_init() with a key and an IV before calling this function. Where the encryption is done, you should free the encryption buffers by calling mcrypt_generic_deinit(). See mcrypt_module_open() for an example.
The default MIME type begins with text/.
The default behavior described above

The default behaviour for constants is to be declared case-sensitive; i.e. CONSTANT and Constant represent different values. If this parameter evaluates to FALSE the constants will be declared as case-insensitive symbols.
The default character set for the current connection
The default flags value
The default host name
The default mode is 0x2 : SplDoublyLinkedList::IT_MODE_LIFO | SplDoublyLinkedList::IT_MODE_KEEP
The default mode is SplPriorityQueue::EXTR_DATA.
The default mode is: SplDoublyLinkedList::IT_MODE_FIFO | SplDoublyLinkedList::IT_MODE_KEEP
The default protocol to use if the URL is missing a scheme name.
The default rule set. This is only available with rule-based formatters.

The default should only change in a full release (7.3.0, 8.0.0, etc) and not in a revision release. The only exception to this is in an emergency when a critical security flaw is found in the current default.

The default translation mode depends on the SAPI and version of PHP that you are using, so you are encouraged to always specify the appropriate flag for portability reasons. You should use the 't' mode if you are working with plain-text files and you use \n to delimit your line endings in your script, but expect your files to be readable with applications such as notepad. You should use the 'b' in all other cases.
The default value for the encoding parameter was changed to UTF-8.
The default value for the encoding parameter was changed to be the value of the default_charset configuration option.
The default value for this field, represented as a string
The default value must be a constant expression, not (for example) a variable, a class member or a function call.

The default value of the length parameter was changed to NULL. A NULLlength now tells the function to use the length of array. Prior to this version, a NULLlength was taken to mean a zero length (nothing will be returned).
The defined

The definition of a word is any string of characters that is immediately after any character listed in the delimiters parameter (By default these are: space, form-feed, newline, carriage return, horizontal tab, and vertical tab).
The deflated string or FALSE if an error occurred.

The delimiter used when splitting up str.
The denominator of the precentage completed expressed as a fraction.
The designated error message for this error. It's limited to 1024 bytes in length. Any additional characters beyond 1024 bytes will be truncated.
The designated error type for this error. It only works with the E_USER family of constants, and will default to E_USER_NOTICE.
The desired format, as configured with one or more of the APC_ITER_* constants.
The desired format, as configured with one or more of the APC_ITER_* constants.
The desired new chunk size.

The destructor
The destructor will be called even if script execution is stopped using exit(). Calling exit() in a destructor will prevent the remaining shutdown routines from executing.
The destructor.
The detected character encoding or FALSE if the encoding cannot be detected from the given string.
The difference between this function and ftp_fget() is that this function retrieves the file asynchronously, so your program can perform other operations while the file is being downloaded.
The difference between this function and ftp_get() is that this function retrieves the file asynchronously, so your program can perform other operations while the file is being downloaded.
The difference between this function and the ftp_fput() is that this function uploads the file asynchronously, so your program can perform other operations while the file is being uploaded.
The difference between this function and the ftp_put() is that this function uploads the file asynchronously, so your program can perform other operations while the file is being uploaded.
The differences described here are with respect to Perl 5.005.
The different forms are defined in terms of a set of transformations on the text, transformations that are expressed by both an algorithm and a set of data files.
The digest algorithm. See openssl_get_md_method().
The digest method or hash algorithm to use, e.g. "sha256", one of openssl_get_md_methods().
The digest method to use, e.g. "sha256", see openssl_get_md_methods() for a list of available digest methods.

The end date of the period.
The end index (in UTF-16 code units) until which the string will be transformed, exclusive. Indexing starts at 0. The text after will be left as is.
The end of a line is a single carriage return, followed by a single linefeed. (This is also known as "\r\n" . The ASCII values are 0x0D0x0A ).
The end of a line is a single linefeed character. (This is also known as "\n" . It is ASCII value is 0x0A .)
The end of line is any sequence of any number of carriage return and linefeed characters. This format is not very useful; it exists mainly for backward compatibility.
The end of the astronomical dusk (zenith angle = 108°). It starts at nautical_twilight_end.
The end of the civil dusk (zenith angle = 96°). It starts at sunset.

The end of the line is an optional carriage return, followed by a linefeed. (In other words, it is either a " " or a " " .) This format is useful in parsing text-based Internet protocols, since the standards generally prescribe a " " line-terminator, but nonconformant clients sometimes say just " " .
The end of the nautical dusk (zenith angle = 102°). It starts at civil_twilight_end.
The ending line number of the user defined class, or FALSE if unknown.
The ending line number of the user defined function, or FALSE if unknown.
The enhanced Gmagick object.
The entire string.
The entries "mail_charset", "mail_header_encoding", and "mail_body_encoding" were made available.
The entries to extract. It accepts either a single entry name or an array of names.
The entry "http_output_conv_mimetypes" was made available.
The entry specified by dn is renamed/moved.
The entry to get.
The environment variable that's being set.
The equality of 2 indices is checked by the user supplied callback function.
The equalized Gmagick object.
The equivalent of number in degrees
The error callback. Should match the following prototype:
The error code
The error code can be retrieved with socket_last_error(). This code may be passed to socket_strerror() to get a textual explanation of the error.
The error code of the SoapFault.
The error code on success, or FALSE if none exists, or on failure.
The error code to return
The error code, one of UErrorCode values. Initial value is U_ZERO_ERROR.
The error code.
The error handler must return FALSE to populate $php_errormsg.
The error message
The error message as a string.
The error message associated with last error that occurred in a function call on this object, or a string indicating the non-existance of an error.
The error message of the SoapFault.
The error message on success, or FALSE if none exists, or on failure.
The error message that should be logged.
The error message, if any.
The error message.
The error number.
The error's code.
The escape character (one character only). Defaults as a backslash (\) or the value set using SplFileObject::setCsvControl().
The escape sequences \v and \f were added.
The escaped string.
The estimated number of entries to retrieve.
The evaluated resource handle.
The evaluation operator
The event base to associate the event with.
The event base to associate with.
The event callback. See Event callbacks .
The event name.
The event priority.
The event(s) that occur on each tick are specified using the register_tick_function(). See the example below for more details. Note that more than one event can occur for each tick.
The exact format of this file is described in T1libs documentation. T1lib comes with two ready-to-use files, <var>IsoLatin1.enc</var> and <var>IsoLatin2.enc</var>.
The exact list of available encodings depends on your PostgreSQL version, so check your PostgreSQL manual for a more specific list.
The examined certificate.
The examined string.

The example above shows how to check if the data before the encryption is the same as the data after the decryption. It is very important to reinitialize the encryption buffer with mcrypt_generic_init() before you try to decrypt the data.
The example above shows how to retrieve the value of the Apache environment variable <var><var>SERVER_ADDR</var></var>.
The example above shows how to use this function when linked against libmcrypt 2.4.x or 2.5.x.

The example above will produce a list with all supported algorithms in the default mode directory. If it is not set with the mcrypt.modes_dirphp.ini directive, the default directory of mcrypt is used (which is /usr/local/lib/libmcrypt).
The example below implements a filter named strtoupper on the foo-bar.txt stream which will capitalize all letter characters written to/read from that stream.

The example below retrieves the organizational unit, surname, given name and email address for all people in "My Company" where the surname or given name contains the substring <var><var>$person</var></var>. This example uses a boolean filter to tell the server to look for information in more than one attribute.
The example below show the retrieval of all the result paginated with 100 entries by page.
The example below show the retrieval of the first page of a search paginated with one entry by page.
The example below shows how to act as a time server which can respond to time queries as shown in an example on stream_socket_client().
The example below shows how to retrieve the day and time from the UDP service "daytime" (port 13) in your own machine.
The example below shows the handling of internal exceptions by triggering errors and handling them with a user defined function:
The example creates a 100x100 black image.
The examples below use the PHP_VERSION constant, because it contains the value of the PHP version that is executing the code.
The exception code
The exception message
The executed statement resource for which the number of affected rows is returned.
The exit code returned by the process (which is only meaningful if running is FALSE). Only first call of this function return real value, next calls return -1.
The expected encoding.

The expected magic database format changed in PHP 5.3.11 and 5.4.1. Due to this, the internal magic database was upgraded. This mostly effects code where an external magic database is used: reading an older magic file will now fail. Also, some textual representations of the mime types has changed, for instance for PHP would be "PHP script, ASCII text" instead of "PHP script text" returned.
The expected output from the above example (assuming the script is not run with root privileges):

The expected size, in bytes, of the file when uploading a file to a remote site. Note that using this option will not stop libcurl from sending more data, as exactly what is sent depends on CURLOPT_READFUNCTION.
The expiration time, defaults to 0. See Expiration Times for more info.
The expiry time to set on the item.
The exponent
The exponent, as a string. If the exponent is non-integral, it is truncated. The valid range of the exponent is platform specific, but is at least -2147483648 to 2147483647.
The exponent, as an non-negative, integral string (i.e. the scale has to be zero).
The exponential symbol.
The exported reflection.
The expression (expr1) ? (expr2) : (expr3) evaluates to expr2 if expr1 evaluates to TRUE, and expr3 if expr1 evaluates to FALSE.
The expression (expr1) ?? (expr2) evaluates to expr2 if expr1 is NULL, and expr1 otherwise.
The expression to be printed.
The expression.

The extended operation request OID. You may use one of LDAP_EXOP_START_TLS, LDAP_EXOP_MODIFY_PASSWD, LDAP_EXOP_REFRESH, LDAP_EXOP_WHO_AM_I, LDAP_EXOP_TURN, or a string with the OID of the operation you want to send.
The extended operation request data. May be NULL for some operations like LDAP_EXOP_WHO_AM_I, may also need to be BER encoded.
The extension information, as a ReflectionExtension object.
The extension name. This parameter is case-insensitive.
The extensions name.
The external attributes. Value depends on operating system.
The external subset public identifier.
The external subset system identifier.
The extra headers. It's used when the message_type parameter is set to 1. This message type uses the same internal function as mail() does.
The facet query

The fact that plain parentheses fulfill two functions is not always helpful. There are often times when a grouping subpattern is required without a capturing requirement. If an opening parenthesis is followed by "?:", the subpattern does not do any capturing, and is not counted when computing the number of any subsequent capturing subpatterns. For example, if the string "the white queen" is matched against the pattern the ((?:red|white) (king|queen)) the captured substrings are "white queen" and "queen", and are numbered 1 and 2. The maximum number of captured substrings is 65535. It may not be possible to compile such large patterns, however, depending on the configuration options of libpcre.
The factor by which the regex fragmenter can stray from the ideal fragment size
The factor by which the regex fragmenter can stray from the ideal fragment size ( specfied by SolrQuery::setHighlightFragsize )to accommodate the regular expression
The factorial number.
The factorial of n.
The feature to test.
The feature to test. See the example of DOMImplementation::hasFeature() for a list of features.
The fetch mode must be one of the PDO::FETCH_* constants.
The field delimiter (one character only).
The field delimiter (one character only). Defaults as a comma or the value set using SplFileObject::setCsvControl().
The field enclosure character (one character only).
The field enclosure character (one character only). Defaults as a double quotation mark or the value set using SplFileObject::setCsvControl().
The field escape character (one character only).
